result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J. Bauman

records.addlTxt: Defendant may leave Oneida County for Funeral in Price County on October 8th or 9th. All other conditions remain.

4:09 PM Defendant Adam J. Bauman in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Adam J. Bauman. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Magallones states case is not resolved - would like to set for a 2 day jury trial. Schiek states motion will be filed. Motions filed can be heard at next hearing. Magallones statement to bond. Bond conditions amended adj. 04:15 PM
Jury trial scheduled for February 15, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 11:30 am.

1:57 PM Defendant Adam J. Bauman in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Adam J. Bauman.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Magallones statement - have been in discussion but not complete yet. Believes it will be settled. Schiek statement
Bail continued
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

plus $5000.00 surety bond - to be signed by grandfather G.B./Must reside with grandfather G.B. at 7550 Forest Trail, Lake Tomahawk, WI/Curfew of 6am - 6 pm unless employed as a payrolled employee for work purposes. May not possess any firearm/May not communicate with any school district employee in Oneida County or have contact with any school district in Oneida county/ May not leave Oneida County without prior permission/ Not possess any device that can connect to the Internet/may use cellphone if it does not have internet access

10:03 AM Defendant Adam J. Bauman appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Adam J. Bauman. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to amend bond has been filed - court has reviewed. Magallones statement to bond/uncooperative victim. Schiek statement to bond/victim/evidence. Court statement to comments in criminal complaint/threats/nature of evidence/bond. Defendant's grandfather in court. Court questions grandfather. Court adjusts cash bond down. Magallones statement to discovery. adj. 10:15 AM

records.addlTxt:
3:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adam J. Bauman appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Adam J. Bauman. Information has been filed - waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bail continued. 03:43 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adam J. Bauman appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Adam J. Bauman. State calls Woodruff Police Department Detective Jeremy Hermann/sworn/direct by Schiek/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Magallones/witness is excused. Magallones/Schiek statement to probable cause. Court/Schiek clarify caller. Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over. Court will set for arraignment. Magallones statement to bond. Court will not address today - Magallones to submit. Bond continued. adj. 11:57 PM
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Magallones states Defendant is eligible for services and will be representing. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. 02:33 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

May not possess any firearm/May not communicate with any school district employee in Oneida County or have contact with any school district in Oneida county/ May not leave Oneida County without prior permission/ Not possess any device that can connect to the Internet

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adam J. Bauman appearing by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Defendant makes statement. Court sets bond. adj. 01:42 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
